posts.title: Gemini
posts.excerpt: Quote: A heinous crime tests the complex relationship between a tenacious personal assistant and her Hollywood starlet boss. As the assistant unravels the mystery, she must confront her own understanding of friendship, truth and celebrity.

posts._title: Jack Deveau – Le musée AKA Strictly Forbidden (1974)
posts.title: Le musée
posts.excerpt: Synopsis/Background wrote: “Don.t let Hollywood fool ya! Gay porn filmmakers in the 1970.s were more creative. And Jack Deveau proves it. In this erotically experimental shot entirely in France, director Deveau has statues coming to life in a art museum, who instructs handsome Thomas Jeffries on his inmost desires. While touring Paris, Thomas is cruised …

posts.title: Left-handed
posts.excerpt: Synopsis/Background wrote: Taglines: This is Ray. He is Left Handed….. Story about an antique dealer, his hustler boyfriend, and their pot dealer — and the relationships that ensue; Deveau’s first film. This film was the first Hand-in-Hand movie, the first scripted gay porn flic, and the first musically scored gay porn flic. It opened in …

posts._title: Pier Paolo Pasolini – I racconti di Canterbury AKA The Canterbury Tales (1972)
posts.title: I racconti di Canterbury
posts.excerpt: Quote: From sun-sparkled Naples to muddy medieval England for chapter two of Pier Paolo Pasolini’s Trilogy of Life — and with all the cornholing, golden showers, and silent-movie mugging Chaucer left out. The most amorphously anecdotal of the three, it’s also the one where the discrepancy between the movies’ notional life-affirmation and the brackish despairing …

posts._title: Hormoz – J’ai rêvé sous l’eau AKA I Dreamt Under the Water (2008)
posts.title: J’ai rêvé sous l’eau
posts.excerpt: Quote: A twentysomething bisexual takes many wrong turns down blind alleys in his search for affection and understanding in this drama from France. Antonin (Hubert Benhamdine) is a young man who is desperate for love and thinks he’s found it with Alex (Franck Victor), a handsome and talented musician. However, Alex is also a heroin …

posts.title: Contes Immoraux (Reconstruction)
posts.excerpt: Plot Summary:.. Four erotic tales from in various historical eras. The first, ‘The Tide’, is set in the present day, and concerns a student and his young female cousin stranded on the beach by the tide, secluded from prying eyes. ‘Therese Philosophe’ is set in the nineteenth century, and concerns a girl being locked in …

posts.title: Accattone
posts.excerpt: Quote: The poet as scrounger-pimp-saint, his life and death. “Long live us thieves… we always know where to go.” Accattone “the cardboard man” (Franco Citti) in the Roman lower depths of dirty sidewalks and angelic statues, a terrain at once squalid and exalted. He ambles around the slums, soaks in his own thick mythology, is …

posts._title: Peter Rosen – Who Gets to Call It Art? (2006)
posts.title: Who Gets to Call It Art?
posts.excerpt: Stupid title aside, this is another recent little documentary which brings together a some rare footage and interviews about the art of the 1960s, the birth of “pop”, and so forth. Not terribly profound, but fun.

posts.title: Mamma Roma
posts.excerpt: Anna Magnani is Mamma Roma, a middle-aged prostitute who attempts to extricate herself from her sordid past for the sake of her son. Filmed in the great tradition of Italian neorealism, Mamma Roma offers an unflinching look at the struggle for survival in postwar Italy, and highlights director Pier Paolo Pasolini’s lifelong fascination with the …

posts._title: Frank Capra – Lady for a Day (1933)
posts.title: Lady for a Day
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: Apple Annie is an indigent woman who has always written to her daughter in Spain that she is a member of New York’s high society. With her daughter suddenly en route to America with her new fiancé and his father, a member of Spain’s aristocracy, Annie must continue her pretense of wealth or the …
